member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.Legacy.UI.Controls.BocBooleanValueImplementation.Rendering.BocBooleanValueQuirksModeRenderer
member.summary: Responsible for rendering controls.

remarks.para: The control is displayed using a encapsulating an to simulate a check box. In read-only mode the Href property is set to emtpy, disabling the hyperlink. It also offers a containing the string representation of the current value, rendered next to the image. A control is used for posting the value back to the server.
These controls cannot be accessed directly, but the appropriate styles are applied.

member.name: M:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.Legacy.UI.Controls.BocBooleanValueImplementation.Rendering.BocBooleanValueQuirksModeRenderer.Render(Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.UI.Controls.BocBooleanValueImplementation.Rendering.BocBooleanValueRenderingContext)
T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.Legacy.UI.Controls.BocBooleanValueImplementation.Rendering.BocCheckBoxQuirksModeRenderer
member.summary: Responsible for rendering controls.

description.para: Priority 1 checkpoint 6.3 is not met if the label provding a textual representation of the value is also rendered. This can be enforced by the configuration entry.
Enabling auto post back can break compliance with priority 1 checkpoint 6.3 if the post back is required for using the page.

remarks.para: The control is displayed using a in edit mode and an in read-only mode. It also offers a containing the string representation of the current value, rendered next to the checkbox or image.
These controls cannot be accessed directly, but the appropriate styles are applied.

member.name: M:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.Legacy.UI.Controls.BocBooleanValueImplementation.Rendering.BocCheckBoxQuirksModeRenderer.Render(Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.UI.Controls.BocBooleanValueImplementation.Rendering.BocCheckBoxRenderingContext)
member.summary: Renders an image and label in readonly mode, a checkbox and label in edit mode.

member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.Legacy.UI.Controls.BocDateTimeValueImplementation.Rendering.BocDateTimeValueQuirksModeRenderer
member.summary: Responsible for rendering controls, but not for the included . For that, see .

description.para: Priority 2 checkpoint 12.4 is not met if the is set to since no label can be provided for the time text box.
Enabling auto post back can break compliance with priority 1 checkpoint 6.3 if the post back is required for using the page.
Priority 2 checkpoints 6.4, 8.1, 9.2, and 9.3 are not met by the pop-up date picker. Since this feature is not required to fill out the date, it does not have to conform to WAI guide lines.
Priority 3 checkpoint 10.4 is not met. The control does not provide place-holder text for the date and time value text boxes.

remarks.para: During edit mode, the control is displayed using two controls, one for the date and the other for the time component. It also displays a pop-up date picker, toggled by an image with a scripted click event. The control uses a table for formatting.
During read-only mode, the control's value is displayed using a single .
These controls cannot be accessed directly, but the appropriate styles are applied.

member.name: F:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.Legacy.UI.Controls.BocDateTimeValueImplementation.Rendering.BocDateTimeValueQuirksModeRenderer.c_designModeEmptyLabelContents
member.summary: Text displayed when control is displayed in desinger and is read-only has no contents.

member.summary: Renders an inline table consisting of one row with up to three cells, depending on . The first one for the date textbox, second for the and third for the time textbox. The text boxes are rendered directly, the date picker is responsible for rendering itself.

member.summary: Responsible for rendering controls.

description.para: Enabling auto post back can break compliance with priority 1 checkpoint 6.3 if the post back is required for using the page.

Priority 2 checkpoint 12.4 is not met if the control is displayed as a drop down box. Internet Explorer resets the selection when the user clicks the label for this control. The label is therefor not associated with the control.

remarks.para: During edit mode, the control is displayed using a . The concrete implementation is determined by 's property.

item.description: Not valid if the views drop down box is enabled. ASP.NET 1.1 renders an invalid attribute.

description.para: Level A conform if advanced features are turned off. This can be enforced by the configuration entry.
Priority 1 checkpoint 6.3 is not met by the following advacned features:

list.item: An event or a WXE command defined for a column.
The drop down menu and the list menu.

description.para: Priority 2 checkpoints 6.5 and 10.1 are not met if the advanced features are enabled.
Priority 2 checkpoint 12.4 is not met if is enabled but is not.
Priority 2 checkpoint 13.1 is not met for links placed into value columns. The column's value is used to identify the link's target.
Interactive sorting requires java-script but is not considered to be required for a usable page.

member.name: M:Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.Legacy.UI.Controls.BocListImplementation.Rendering.BocListTableBlockQuirksModeRenderer.Render(Remotion.ObjectBinding.Web.UI.Controls.BocListImplementation.Rendering.BocListRenderingContext)
member.summary: Renders the data contained in as a table.
member.remarks: The table consists of a title row showing the column titles, and a data row for each in . If there is no data, the table will be completely hidden (only one cell containing only whitespace) if is and is editable or if is and is read-only. Exception: at design time, the title row will always be visible.
